result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pre-trial conference on September 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  * J.R. *Unless the victim goes to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then files the form with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.
If released, then the defendant is to reside with A.D. at 3124 Jefferson St., in Stevens Point WI 54481.

10:15 a.m.  Defendant Carl E. Dickerson II in court, in custody.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA)  Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Carl E. Dickerson II. 

Court calls the case.
ADA Cassidy states the appearances.
This is set for a Motion Hearing to Modify Bond.
State is contesting this bond modification.
Atty Soule puts on the record her reasons for the request for the bond modification.
Court questions Atty Soule. 
State opposes the modification and states the reasons for the opposition on the record.
Court questions ADA Cassidy and she responds.
Court questions the home address of the defendant.  
Atty Soule updates the address on the record and if the bond is not modified then his address will be the Waupaca County Jail in the interim.
Atty Soule states that her client is able to post $500 in cash and not the $2,500.
Court reviews cases as shown on CCAP and they all have different addresses.
Atty Soule states that Portage County is his "home address".
Court shows some of the same concerns as the State and puts these concerns on the record.
Court believes that some cash is appropriate.

BY THE COURT:
Court reduces the bond to $1,500 with conditions as stated on the record.

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, the court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

1:15 PM Defendant Carl E. Dickerson II appeared by video, in custody at the Waupaca County Jail.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Carl E. Dickerson II.

Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.

1:20 PM Defendant Carl Eugene Dickerson III appeared by video, in custody.  Atty Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 

ADA Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of possession of methamphetamine, battery to law enforcement, obstructing/resisting an officer, misdemeanor bail jumping and misdemeanor battery - domestic abuse.
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $500 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule objects to the cash bond and states her objections on the record.
Defendant is public defender eligible.
